results.question: What should I do to jump start the car?
results.ground_truth_answer:
To jump start the car, you should follow these steps:

- Prepare for jump starting by applying the parking brake, shifting the transmission into PARK or NEUTRAL, turning off the ignition, and all electrical accessories.
- Make sure the vehicle providing the jump start is parked within reach of the jumper cables, with the ignition turned OFF.
- Only use the positive battery post on the main battery to jump start your vehicle.
- Avoid using a booster battery greater than 12 Volts.
- Ensure that cable clamps do not touch each other.
- Lift up the protective cap on the positive battery post to gain access.
- Do not allow vehicles to touch each other.
- Avoid the radiator cooling fan when the hood is raised.
- Remove any metal jewelry that could make inadvertent electrical contact.
- Keep open flames or sparks away from the battery.

After following these preparations, you can proceed with the jump starting procedure.

1. Apply the parking brake and shift the automatic transmission into PARK (P) or manual transmission into NEUTRAL.
2. Place the ignition in OFF mode.
3. Turn off the heater, radio, and all electrical accessories.
4. If using another vehicle to jump start, park it within the jumper cable's reach, apply the parking brake, and ensure the ignition is OFF.
5. Use a set of jumper cables and connect them to the positive battery post on the main battery of your vehicle and the other vehicle (or a portable battery booster pack).
6. Follow proper jump starting procedures carefully to avoid injury or damage.

Important warnings:
- Only use the positive battery post on the main battery to jump start your vehicle.
- Do not attempt jump starting if the battery is frozen.
- Do not use a portable battery booster pack with a system voltage greater than 12 Volts.
- Keep flame or sparks away from the battery, as battery gas is flammable and explosive.

results.question: What should I pay attention to for the clutch pedal?
results.ground_truth_answer:
Based on the provided context, here are the key things to pay attention to regarding the clutch pedal:

1. Fully press the clutch pedal before shifting gears. Pressing the clutch pedal all the way down is necessary when changing gears to prevent damage to the transmission.

2. As you release the clutch pedal, lightly press the accelerator pedal. This coordination of the clutch and accelerator is important for smooth gear shifts.

3. Certain noise from the transmission may be noticeable when the clutch is engaged (pedal released). This noise is normal and not an indication of a problem with the clutch or transmission.

4. Ensure the carpet is securely attached and does not interfere with the operation of the clutch pedal. Unattached or improperly placed carpet could get stuck under the clutch pedal and cause a loss of vehicle control.

In summary, focus on fully pressing and properly releasing the clutch pedal during gear shifts, be aware of normal transmission noises, and ensure the floor carpet does not impact clutch pedal operation.

results.question: how to set up Android Auto?
results.ground_truth_answer:
Based on the context provided, here are the steps to set up Android Auto:

1. Download the Android Auto app from the Google Play store on your Android-powered smartphone.

2. Connect your Android-powered smartphone to one of the media USB ports in your vehicle. If the Android Auto app was not previously downloaded, it will begin downloading when you first plug in your device.

3. Make sure your vehicle is in PARK the first time you use the app.

4. Use the factory-provided USB cable that came with your phone, as aftermarket cables may not work.

5. Ensure you are in an area with cellular coverage, as Android Auto may use cellular data from your smartphone's data plan.

6. Once the device is connected and recognized, the Phone icon on the drag & drop menu bar will change to the Android Auto icon.

7. The Android Auto app will display all the compatible apps that can be used with Android Auto. You must have the compatible app downloaded and be signed in through your mobile device for it to work with Android Auto.

8. To use Android Auto, you'll need an Android phone running Android 6.0 or higher, an active data plan, and the Android Auto app.

9. You can launch Android Auto by connecting your compatible device or by pressing the Android Auto icon on the touchscreen.

1. Connect your Android 6.0 or higher device to one of the media USB ports using the factory-provided USB cable.
2. Press the new Android Auto icon that replaces your Phone icon on the main menu bar to begin Android Auto.
3. Ensure you have the Android Auto app downloaded and are signed in to the app through your mobile device.
4. Activate the voice recognition system by pushing and holding the VR button on the steering wheel or pressing and holding the Microphone icon within Android Auto.
5. Launch Android Auto by pressing the Android Auto icon on the touchscreen or by plugging in your smartphone device to a USB port (if equipped).

Note: You'll need an Android phone running Android 6.0 or higher, an active data plan, and the Android Auto app to use Android Auto on your car display.

results.question: Can I deactivate the DRLs?
results.ground_truth_answer:
Based on the provided context, it seems that the ability to deactivate the Daytime Running Lights (DRLs) depends on the specific vehicle and the market it is sold in.

For vehicles sold in Canada, the context indicates that the headlight switch does not have an "OFF" detent. Instead, the headlights will be deactivated when the headlight switch is placed in the parking lights position. However, the DRLs will still be activated along with the front and rear marker lights in this scenario.

The context also mentions that the DRLs may be deactivated when the parking brake is engaged, and that for vehicles sold in Canada, the DRLs will automatically deactivate when the front fog lights are turned on.

Additionally, the context states that on some vehicles, the Daytime Running Lights may deactivate or reduce intensity on one side of the vehicle when a turn signal is activated on that side, or on both sides of the vehicle when the hazard warning lights are activated.

However, the context does not explicitly state that the DRLs can be manually deactivated by the driver. The information provided suggests that the ability to deactivate the DRLs may be limited or controlled by the vehicle's design and features, rather than being a user-configurable option.

Therefore, based on the given context, it is not clear if the DRLs can be deactivated by the driver. The ability to deactivate them may depend on the specific vehicle model and market regulations.

4. When the hazard warning lights are activated, the DRLs on both sides of the vehicle may deactivate or reduce intensity.

However, it is not explicitly stated that the driver can manually deactivate the DRLs. It is mentioned that some functions, like BeltAlert, can be activated or deactivated by an authorized dealer, but it does not mention the DRLs being deactivated by the driver or the dealer.

results.question: What can the SOS Call button do?
results.ground_truth_answer:
Based on the context provided, the SOS Call button on the vehicle's overhead console has the following functionalities:

1. Initiating an SOS call to an SOS operator:
   - Pushing the SOS Call button will initiate a call to an SOS operator.
   - The SOS Call system will transmit important vehicle information to the SOS operator, including the vehicle brand, last known GPS coordinates, and an indication that the occupant placed an SOS call.

2. Cancellation of the SOS call:
   - There is a 10-second delay before the SOS Call system initiates the call to the SOS operator.
   - During this 10-second delay, the SOS Call can be canceled by pushing the SOS Call button again or by pressing the cancellation button on the device screen.
   - Terminating the SOS Call will turn off the green LED light on the overhead console.

3. Voice connection with the SOS operator:
   - Once the SOS Call connection is established, the occupants can speak with the SOS operator through the vehicle's audio system to determine if additional help is needed.

4. Emergency response assistance:
   - The SOS operator may attempt to contact appropriate emergency responders and provide them with the vehicle's important information and GPS coordinates.

In summary, the SOS Call button allows the vehicle occupants to initiate an emergency call, communicate with the SOS operator, and potentially receive emergency assistance if needed.

results.question: How to make my steering wheel heated?
results.ground_truth_answer: To make your steering wheel heated, you need to locate the heated steering wheel button on the center of the instrument panel below the radio screen, or within the Climate or Controls screen of the touchscreen. Press the heated steering wheel button once to turn the heating element on. Press the button again to turn the heating element off. Remember, the engine must be running for the heated steering wheel to operate. Additionally, be cautious as the heating element can cause burns, especially if used for long periods, so individuals with certain physical conditions should be extra careful when using it. Do not place anything on the steering wheel that insulates against heat to avoid overheating.

results.question: Can I change the desired speed when the Cruise Control is on?
results.ground_truth_answer:
Yes, you can change the desired speed when the Cruise Control is on. The context provided indicates that you can do this by:

1. Pushing the SET (+) or SET (-) button when the vehicle has reached the desired speed. This will set the new desired speed.

2. If the vehicle speed is below 20 mph (32 km/h) when you set the cruise control, the set speed will default to 20 mph (32 km/h).

3. If the vehicle speed is above 20 mph (32 km/h) when you set the cruise control, the set speed will be the current vehicle speed.

So in summary, the instructions clearly state that you can adjust the desired speed by using the SET (+) and SET (-) buttons while the Cruise Control is active.

results.question: What is special about power windows?
results.ground_truth_answer: Power windows have an Auto-Down feature where the window will go down automatically if the window switch is pushed down past the detent and released.
results.generated_response: The power windows have an Auto-Down feature on the driver and front passenger door switches, which allows the windows to go down automatically when the switch is pushed down past the detent and released. Additionally, the power window switches remain active for up to 10 minutes after the ignition is turned off, and can be stopped during Auto-Down operation by pulling up on the switch briefly.
retrieved_chunks: The power windows feature allows for movement of the windows with the push of a button. The power window switches are located on the instrument panel below the climate controls. Push the switch downward to open the window and pull upward to close the window. The driver door power window switch and the front passenger door power window switch have an Auto-Down feature. Push the window switch down, past the detent, and release and the window will go down automatically.

The driver door power window switch and the front passenger door power window switch have an Auto-Down feature. Push the window switch down, past the detent, and release and the window will go down automatically. Power Window Switches Never leave children unattended in a vehicle, and do not let children play with power windows. Do not leave the key fob in or near the vehicle, or in a location accessible to children. Occupants, particularly unattended children, can become entrapped by the windows while operating the power window switches.

The power window switches will remain active for up to 10 minutes after the ignition is placed in the OFF position. Opening either front door will cancel this feature. There are window switches located on the rear of the center console for the rear passenger windows. Auto-Down Feature The driver door power window switch and the front passenger door power window switch have an Auto-Down feature. Push the window switch down, past the detent, and release and the window will go down automatically.

Do not leave the key fob in or near the vehicle, or in a location accessible to children. Occupants, particularly unattended children, can become entrapped by the windows while operating the power window switches. Such entrapment may result in serious injury or death. The power window switches will remain active for up to 10 minutes after the ignition is placed in the OFF position. Opening either front door will cancel this feature.

To stop the window from going all the way down during the Auto-Down operation, pull up on the switch briefly. WARNING: There is no anti-pinch protection when the window is almost closed. Be sure to clear all objects from the window before closing. Power Door Locks — If Equipped The power door lock switch is located on each front door panel. Push the switch forward to unlock the doors, and rearward to lock the doors.
